intro: Argythamnia anisotricha, commonly known as the desert sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures. Its foliage is often covered with fine, glandular hairs that help reduce water loss. Argythamnia anisotricha plays a role in stabilizing desert soils and providing habitat for small desert organisms.
